if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"changeVaultOwner(address)":{"custom:function-name":"changeVaultOwner","details":"this function is used to tranfer ownership and all roles from one account to another while also removing all permissions on the previous account","params":{"newOwner":"the new contract owner"}},"constructor":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow":"constructor","details":"_disableInitializers prevents future reinitializations [_disableInitializers](https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/5.x/api/proxy#Initializable-_disableInitializers--) for more info"},"controllerLimits(address)":{"custom:function-name":"controllerLimits","details":"this function is used to check the remaining limits of a given controller","params":{"controller":"the controller address"},"returns":{"allowance":"the max amount of reward tokens left","quota":"the max amount of users left"}},"controllerLimitsEnabled()":{"custom:function-name":"controllerLimitsEnabled","details":"this function is used to check if the limits on the controllers is in effect or not","returns":{"_0":"enabled is controller limits enabled or not"}},"defaultControllerLimits()":{"custom:function-name":"defaultControllerLimits","details":"this function is used to check the default controller limits the contract is currently using","returns":{"allowance":"the max amount of reward tokens","quota":"the max amount of users"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getVaultInfo()":{"custom:function-name":"getVaultInfo","details":"this function is used to fetch the vault info of the vault","returns":{"_0":"info the vault info of the contract"}},"grantPermit(address)":{"custom:function-name":"grantPermit","details":"used to grant permision for selected (onlyRole Restricted) functions to the controller","params":{"controller":"the controller contract"}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,(uint256,string,address,string,address,uint256,address))":{"custom:function-name":"initialize","details":"this is used in palce of a constructor to initialize a proxy's state using this implemetation's logic","params":{"_vaultInfo":"the vault info that will be saved on the contract","initialAdmin":"the initial admin and the owner of the contract"}},"isController(address)":{"custom:function-name":"isController","details":"used to check if an address is a controller or has a controller access","params":{"controller":"the controller address"}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokePermit(address)":{"custom:function-name":"revokePermit","details":"used to grant permision for selected (onlyRole Restricted) functions to the controller","params":{"controller":"the controller contract"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"reward(address,uint256)":{"custom:function-name":"reward","details":"this function is used to reward a single user of a specified amount of reward token","params":{"amount":"the amount of tokens to reward","to":"the receiver of the reward"},"returns":{"_0":"success if the transaction succeeded or not"}},"rewardBatch((address,uint256)[])":{"custom:function-name":"rewardBatch","custom:sub-param":"`receiver` - address of the user to reward`amount` - amount of token to reward the user","details":"this function is used to reward users in batches","params":{"receivers":"an array of receivers to send rewards to"},"returns":{"returnData":"the result of the batch reward transaction"}},"rewardPool()":{"custom:function-name":"rewardPool","details":"this function is used to view the remaining balance of the contract for the * currently set reward token","returns":{"_0":"pool the amount of reward tokens left for rewards"}},"setControllerLimits(address,uint256,uint256)":{"custom:function-name":"setControllerLimits","details":"this function is used to set the limits on specifc controllers","params":{"controller":"the controller address","quota":"the max amount of users the controller is allowed to reward","rewardAllowance":"the max amount of reward token the controller is allowed to distribute"}},"setDefaultControllerLimits(uint256,uint256)":{"custom:function-name":"setDefaultControllerLimits","details":"this function is used to set the default limits that will be used when granting controller permit","params":{"quota":"the max amount of users the controller is allowed to reward","rewardAllowance":"the max amount of reward token the controller is allowed to distribute"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"toggleControllerLimits()":{"custom:function-name":"toggleControllerLimits","details":"this function is used to toggle whether to limit the controllers or not"},"updateRewardToken(address)":{"custom:function-name":"updateRewardToken","details":"this function is used to change the reward token used in rewarding users","params":{"newRewardToken":"the new reward token"}},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."},"withdrawToken(address,uint256)":{"custom:function-name":"withdrawToken","details":"this function is used to withdraw tokens from the contract for various reasons like; - incorrect token deposit - unused reward token and more","params":{"amount":"the amount of token to withdraw","tokenAddress":"the token address the admin wants to withdraw"},"returns":{"_0":"success if the transaction succeeded"}}},"stateVariables":{"contractType":{"details":"this function shows the type of the contract","return":"contractType the contract type in changeVaultOwner(address).details: this function is used to tranfer ownership and all roles from one account to another while also removing all permissions on the previous account

constructor.details: _disableInitializers prevents future reinitializations [_disableInitializers](https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/5.x/api/proxy#Initializable-_disableInitializers--) for more info

controllerLimits(address).details: this function is used to check the remaining limits of a given controller

returns.allowance: the max amount of reward tokens left
returns.quota: the max amount of users left

controllerLimitsEnabled().details: this function is used to check if the limits on the controllers is in effect or not

returns._0: enabled is controller limits enabled or not

defaultControllerLimits().details: this function is used to check the default controller limits the contract is currently using

returns.allowance: the max amount of reward tokens

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getVaultInfo().details: this function is used to fetch the vault info of the vault

returns._0: info the vault info of the contract

grantPermit(address).details: used to grant permision for selected (onlyRole Restricted) functions to the controller

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

initialize(address,(uint256,string,addre.details: this is used in palce of a constructor to initialize a proxy's state using this implemetation's logic

params._vaultInfo: the vault info that will be saved on the contract
params.initialAdmin: the initial admin and the owner of the contract

isController(address).details: used to check if an address is a controller or has a controller access

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokePermit(address).details: used to grant permision for selected (onlyRole Restricted) functions to the controller

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

reward(address,uint256).details: this function is used to reward a single user of a specified amount of reward token

params.amount: the amount of tokens to reward

returns._0: success if the transaction succeeded or not

rewardBatch((address,uint256)[]).custom:sub-param: `receiver` - address of the user to reward`amount` - amount of token to reward the user
rewardBatch((address,uint256)[]).details: this function is used to reward users in batches

params.receivers: an array of receivers to send rewards to

returns.returnData: the result of the batch reward transaction

rewardPool().details: this function is used to view the remaining balance of the contract for the * currently set reward token

returns._0: pool the amount of reward tokens left for rewards

setControllerLimits(address,uint256,uint.details: this function is used to set the limits on specifc controllers

params.quota: the max amount of users the controller is allowed to reward
params.rewardAllowance: the max amount of reward token the controller is allowed to distribute

setDefaultControllerLimits(uint256,uint2.details: this function is used to set the default limits that will be used when granting controller permit

params.quota: the max amount of users the controller is allowed to reward
params.rewardAllowance: the max amount of reward token the controller is allowed to distribute

toggleControllerLimits().details: this function is used to toggle whether to limit the controllers or not

updateRewardToken(address).details: this function is used to change the reward token used in rewarding users

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdrawToken(address,uint256).details: this function is used to withdraw tokens from the contract for various reasons like; - incorrect token deposit - unused reward token and more

params.amount: the amount of token to withdraw
params.tokenAddress: the token address the admin wants to withdraw
